=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Below is an analysis of the game based on the rules:

1. Game Genre and Setting:
 • It’s a space shooter set against a cosmic background, where a spaceship (the avatar) and various enemy types come into play.  
 • The scene includes a stationary “base” (represented by a planet image) and enemy-producing “portals” that spawn different types of alien ships.

2. Game Mechanics:
 • The player controls an avatar—a spaceship that can shoot bullets (named “sam”).  
 • The avatar’s bullets and a special “missile” can be fired. When these projectiles hit the edges of the screen (EOS), they are removed.  
 • Enemies, called aliens (with both blue and green variants), move around and can drop bombs. Their movement includes bouncing off the screen edges (turning around on collision with an EOS).  
 • Bombs drop downward slowly. They, along with other sprite interactions, have specific collision behaviors (for example, when a bomb reaches the base or collides with the avatar, both interacting sprites are “killed”).

3. Objectives and Win/Loss Conditions:
 • The player must keep the avatar alive—losing the avatar ends the game in a loss.  
 • You score points by eliminating enemies with your bullets:  
  – If a “sam” bullet hits the base, both the bullet and base are destroyed, but you get a small bonus (score +1).  
  – When an alien is struck by a bullet (“sam”), the alien is destroyed and you receive a bonus (score +2).  
  – Collisions where the avatar itself contacts aliens or bombs result in penalties (score –1 and the enemy or bomb being removed).  
 • The game eventually ends in a win when there are no enemy portals and no aliens left on the screen (i.e. when all enemy spawns and their active instances have been cleared).

4. Overall Strategy:
 • Stay on the move and avoid contact: Since collisions with aliens or bombs decrease your score, precise movement is key.  
 • Use your shooting effectively: Aim your “sam” bullets to take out aliens before they can drop bombs or get too close. Eliminating aliens earns you points, so prioritize their destruction.  
 • Manage risk around the base: Some interactions involve the base (like bombs reaching it will kill both the bomb and the base) so consider how you position yourself relative to both the base and the enemy waves.  
 • Patience and timing: Enemies spawn from portals at set intervals. By staying alive and carefully timing your shots, you can gradually clear the screen of aliens.  
 • Maintain awareness: Watch for the bomb-dropping aliens and use your projectiles both defensively (to prevent damage) and offensively (to rack up points).
 
In summary, the game is a classic space shooter where keeping your spaceship safe and strategically eliminating enemy aliens (while avoiding bombs) is key to achieving victory. The balance between offense and evasion, along with managing spawn timing from enemy portals, forms the crux of a winning strategy.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
